paragraphs.text: This week’s edition of Tech Tuesday focuses on the top five niche tools that can help small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) navigate the complex world of debt management and financial recovery.

As many businesses continue to face financial struggles in the wake of economic disruptions, it’s more important than ever for SMEs to have access to specialized resources that can offer tailored solutions. From debt restructuring platforms to fast access to capital and robust accounting tools, these platforms are designed to help businesses regain control over their finances, avoid insolvency, and stay afloat during tough times.
Let’s dive into the top 5 tools that could make all the difference for your business.

What it is: Jirav is a financial planning and analysis (FP&A) platform designed to help businesses restructure and optimize their financial operations. It helps startups and businesses forecast their financials, manage cash flow, and prepare for potential debt restructuring.
Pricing: Custom pricing based on business needs.

What it is: Insolvency Experts provides solutions for businesses facing financial difficulties, including debt restructuring and formal insolvency procedures. They offer debt negotiation, restructuring advice, and assistance with voluntary administration and liquidation.
Pricing: Consultation fees vary depending on the complexity of the case.

What it is: Prospa is a digital lender focused on providing small businesses with unsecured loans to help them manage their financial challenges, including debt restructuring. It offers flexible financing options that can assist businesses in consolidating existing debt and securing additional capital for growth.
Pricing: Loan amounts range from $5,000 to $300,000 with interest rates starting at 8.99%. Fees vary based on the loan amount.

What it is: Spotcap is an online lender offering small businesses the flexibility to restructure their debt by providing fast access to loans. Businesses can use Spotcap’s loans to manage cash flow, consolidate debt, or even refinance their existing obligations.
Pricing: Loan amounts start from $50,000 and interest rates begin around 10%, with fees ranging from 2%-3% of the loan amount.

What it is: Xero is a cloud-based accounting software that helps small businesses manage their finances, including debt restructuring and cash flow management. Xero offers a comprehensive set of tools that can track outstanding debt, manage creditors, and generate financial reports.
